25.12.text: First in the spotlight tonight is Martin Wightman,

27.60.text: a retired civil servant from Bristol.

29.56.text: He's answering questions on the Apollo missions.

32.12.text: Next, Roger Canwell from Norwich on the Great Train Robbery.

35.64.text: Austin McHale is a teacher from Middlesex.

38.00.text: His specialist subject, Queens Park Rangers football club.

42.84.text: is a technical support agent from Bournemouth.

45.24.text: Her subject, Jonathan Kellerman's Alex Delaware novels.

60.92.text: Hello and welcome to Mastermind with me, John Humphrys.

64.28.text: Four contenders are waiting to take their place in the black chair.

68.44.text: It's not just about knowing the answers, of course.

73.04.text: The pressure of being in the spotlight and even worse,

76.00.text: knowing that the clock is ticking away

78.24.text: and does not allow you the luxury of thinking time.

80.76.text: As always, they get two minutes of questions

82.84.text: on their specialist subject and then two and a half on general knowledge.

86.28.text: The winner will go through to the next round

88.16.text: and take a step nearer to becoming the owner of a rather fine

90.96.text: glass bowl and far more importantly,

92.80.text: the prestige of becoming Mastermind champion.

95.44.text: So, let us have our first contender, please.
